title: Wife, 45, has her arm sliced off by a propeller in front of her horrified pilot husband
text:
A woman had her arm hacked off by a plane's propeller in front of her horrified husband after she climbed out the aircraft ahead of take-off in Florida.

Lynn Gray, 45, was with her spouse Walter, both from Naples, at Key West International Airport on Saturday at around 8.45pm when their single-engine plane became stuck.

Mr Gray, who was the pilot, left the plane running to investigate the issue after being unable to taxi the rented Cessna 172S down the runway, according to the Monroe County Sheriff's Office.

Lynn Gray, 45, was with her spouse Walter, both from Naples, at Key West International Airport on Saturday at around 8.45pm when their rented Cessna 172S became stuck (stock photo)

He checked to see if the wheel chock - a block placed in front of tyres when a plane is stationary on the tarmac - were still in place after 'would not move or was having some other unknown mechanical issue,' authorities said.

Although told to stay inside, Mrs Gray also got out to help free the wheel before she was sliced by the propellers at the front of the aircraft.

Her arm was reportedly severed and she was airlifted to hospital in Miami.

It was initially reported that Mrs Gray's foot was also hacked off, but authorities later confirmed she lost just her arm.

She is reportedly in a stable condition after she was transferred from Lower Keys Medical Center on Stock Island to Ryder Trauma Center in Miami.

Authorities do not know why the plane would not start. The Florida Highway Patrol is handling the investigation.
